snippet: With labor unrest boiling into violence, the terms of the fragile consensus that kept Africa’s richest economy going through the transition from apartheid are threatening to unravel.
abstract: Labor unrest, broad disillusionment, dimming economic prospects and political inertia represent possibly most serious crisis South Africa’s young democracy has faced; terms of the fragile consensus that kept Africa’s richest economy going through the transition from apartheid are threatening to unravel.
lead_paragraph: With labor unrest boiling into violence, the terms of the fragile consensus that kept Africa’s richest economy going through the transition from apartheid are threatening to unravel.

headline.main: Upheaval Grips South Africa as Hopes for Its Workers Fade
headline.print_headline: Unfulfilled Promises Are Replacing Prospects of a Better Life in South Africa
